Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: EQUIPMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a specific peice of equipment.
Column Comment.3: EQUIPMENT OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for this row of data.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.7: INSTALLED BASE DEPTH: The base depth for this piece of equipment.
Column Comment.9: INSTALLED DATE: date on which the equipment was installed.
Column Comment.10: INSTALLATION SEQUENCE NUMBER: indicates the relative order in whichequipment is installed in the well bore from top to base.
Column Comment.11: INSTALLED TOP DEPTH: The installed top depth for this peice of equipment.
Column Comment.13: PARENT EQUIPMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a specific peice ofequipment in the case where the piece identified in this row is part of a compositepeice of equipment.
Column Comment.14: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.15: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.16: REMOVAL DATE: date on which the equipment was removed.
Column Comment.17: STRING IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying a production string withina well.
Column Comment.18: STRING SOURCE: the source of data for the PROD STRING
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
